title: Immune-Related Adverse Events for GI Toxicity - Colitis
desc: The Immune-Related Adverse Events for GI Toxicity - Colitis grades severity of colitis secondary to immune checkpoint inhibitor therapy.

orgreference.text: Brahmer JR, Lacchetti C, Schneider BJ, et al. Management of Immune-Related Adverse Events in Patients Treated With Immune Checkpoint Inhibitor Therapy: American Society of Clinical Oncology Clinical Practice Guideline. J Clin Oncol. 2018;36(17):1714-1768.

data.evidence:
CTCAE for diarrhea

 Colitis grade
Increase of <4 stools per day over baseline; mild increase in ostomy output compared with baseline

G1
Increase of 4-6 stools per day over baseline; moderate increase in ostomy output compared with baseline

G2

Increase of ≥7 stools per day over baseline; incontinence; hospitalization indicated; severe increase in ostomy output compared with baseline; limiting self-care/activities of daily living

G3
Life-threatening consequences; urgent intervention indicated

G4

See Next Steps for details on management.
